snippet: Prosecuting Judge Baltasar Garzón for digging into Franco-era crimes is an offense against justice and history.
abstract: Editorial laments the fact that Spanish Judge Baltasar Garzon is on trial for daring to open an inquiry into atrocities committed during and after Spain's 1936-39 civil war; argues that the Spanish Supreme Court should have never accepted the case, but now that it has, it must acquit Garzon.
lead_paragraph: Prosecuting Judge Baltasar Garzón for digging into Franco-era crimes is an offense against justice and history.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
